intro: Rudgea nivosa, commonly known as the snow rudgea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white, tubular flowers that bloom in the spring. Rudgea nivosa thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky soils and alpine meadows. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
